author: wsjcom
title: Lessons from the Sad ‘Love Death’ of Levine’s Career
text: Terry Teachout’s “No, the Fat Lady Hasn’t Sung” (Sightings, March 14) suggests that the Metropolitan Opera should dismiss its general manager Peter Gelb and board of directors even after they were exonerated by the company’s private investigation leading to the firing of conductor James Levine for sexual misconduct. Mr. Teachout’s insistence on public disclosure of a private inquiry’s details won’t remedy issues that occurred many years before the arrival of Mr. Gelb and current board members. Judging from a recent email that, as a patron, I received from the Met board leadership, the company is striving to restore confidence...
